alert.note: Alert for City of Suffolk; Isle of Wight (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 19 at 2:48PM EDT until July 19 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Isle of Wight County in southeastern Virginia... The north central City of Suffolk in southeastern Virginia... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 248 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Isle Of Wight, or near Windsor, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Smithfield around 300 PM EDT. Suffolk and Crittenden around 305 PM EDT. Rescue around 310 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Central Hill, Hobson, Carrollton, Longview, Benns Church, Wills Corner, Bethel Church, Mogarts Beach, Chuckatuck and Lawson. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: City of Suffolk; Isle of Wight
